content:
Meal prepping on Sundays is a great habit! I'd be happy to suggest some quick, healthy, and delicious breakfast ideas that are perfect for a lighter Sunday morning. Here are some options that can be prepared in no more than 30 minutes:

1. **Overnight Oats**: Mix rolled oats, milk, and your choice of nuts, seeds, or fruit in a jar or container. Refrigerate overnight and enjoy in the morning. (5 minutes prep time)
2. **Avocado Toast**: Toast whole grain bread, mash an avocado, and spread it on top. Add a sliced egg, salt, and pepper to taste. (10 minutes prep time)
3. **Yogurt Parfait**: Layer Greek yogurt, fresh berries, and granola in a bowl. You can also add a sprinkle of honey or a sprinkle of cinnamon. (5 minutes prep time)
4. **Smoothie**: Blend together your favorite fruits, yogurt, and milk to make a quick and nutritious breakfast smoothie. (5 minutes prep time)
5. **Peanut Butter Banana Toast**: Toast whole grain bread, spread with peanut butter, and top with sliced banana. (5 minutes prep time)
6. **Breakfast Muffins**: Prepare a batch of healthy muffins on Sunday and store them in an airtight container for up to 3 days. You can make blueberry, banana, or cinnamon apple muffins. (20 minutes prep time)
7. **Hard-Boiled Eggs**: Boil a dozen eggs on Sunday and keep them in the fridge for a quick protein-packed breakfast throughout the week. (10 minutes prep time)
8. **Chia Seed Pudding**: Mix chia seeds with almond milk and let it sit in the fridge overnight. Top with fresh fruit and nuts in the morning. (5 minutes prep time)
9. **Cottage Cheese and Fruit**: Mix cottage cheese with fruit such as berries or sliced peaches for a high-protein breakfast. (5 minutes prep time)
10. **Green Smoothie Bowl**: Blend together spinach, avocado, banana, and milk, then top with fresh fruit, nuts, and seeds. (10 minutes prep time)

These breakfast ideas are not only quick but also packed with nutrients to keep you energized throughout the morning. Enjoy your meal prep Sunday!
